metadata.synopsis: | A social worker in charge of a refugee hostel is speaking with a father and his child, both of whom are seeking refuge. The social worker informs the father that, in order to prevent the spread of lice in the hostel, he must burn his child's clothes and thoroughly clean the child's hair. The social worker is concerned with maintaining order and ensuring that everyone in the hostel has a safe and clean place to stay. The family lost their mother and the father does not know how to take care of the kid properly.|
metadata.how_to_trigger: Goto CTY_Main_A and goto 93 -63. Worker, Father and Child are all on the ground floor of Refugee hostel

2.speaker: Hostel Mother Pammella Nortale
2.text: No need to look so glum. You'll be clean and comfortable in no time.

0.speaker: Dholber Greene
0.text: I'm so embarrassed. I - I'm sorry. We must have caught them riding on the ox cart.

3.speaker: Hostel Mother Pammella Nortale
3.text: No sense apologising for what can't be helped. You made it here safely - that's what matters.

6.speaker: Hostel Mother Pammella Nortale
6.text: Rules are the same for everyone: clothes go in the fire, comb goes through the hair. We'll have no lice in here.

5.speaker: Dholber Greene
5.text: Burn my son's clothes? But I've nothing else for him to wear.

1.speaker: Hostel Mother Pammella Nortale
1.text: We've plenty of donations. I'm sure you'll find something that fits.

4.speaker: Hostel Mother Pammella Nortale
4.text: Hot soapy water and a fine-tooth comb - that's all you need. Those lice will be gone in no time.

8.speaker: Dholber Greene
8.text: His mother was better with this kind of thing... I'll do my best.
8.context: NodeContext: Apologetic, sad - his wife has died
